triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core technology that enables the multi-agent systems surveyed in this paper.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems are the primary focus of this survey, representing systems of multiple interacting intelligent agents.

triples.name: Autonomous system
triples.relevance: Autonomous systems form the conceptual foundation for understanding independent, self-governing agents in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Automated reasoning
triples.relevance: Automated reasoning underlies the reasoning capabilities of LLM-based agents in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Automated planning is essential for the planning capabilities of agents in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Artificial intelligence is the foundational field that encompasses all aspects of LLM-based multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Problem solving
triples.relevance: Problem-solving is one of the two principal application areas for LLM-based multi-agent systems discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Simulation
triples.relevance: World simulation is the second principal application area for LLM-based multi-agent systems discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Workflow
triples.relevance: Workflow is the organizing framework used to structure the components and interactions of LLM-based multi-agent systems.
